roleset.name: become more liberal

role.descr: thing becoming more liberal (if separate from arg0)

example.name: liberalize-v: usually transitive
example.text: At a June EC summit, Mrs. Thatcher appeared to ease her opposition to full EMS membership, saying Britain would join once its inflation rate fell and the EC liberalized capital movements.

example.name: liberalize-v: oddly intransitive
example.text: Asked if [the Soviets]-1, like Chinese officials, won't one day face a similar conflict between the desire *trace*-1 to liberalize economically and yet retain political control, Mr. Lee said, ``I would think that the Soviets face a deeper dilemma because they have been more in blinkers than the Chinese -- I mean keeping their people cut off from the outside world.''

example.name: liberalize-v: passive
example.text: [The market for export financing]-1 was liberalized *trace*-1 in the mid-1980s, however, forcing the bank to face competition.
example.arg: forcing the bank to face competition.

example.name: liberalization-n: both args
example.text: To further the evidence, the organization Green Peace has warned the WTO that their liberalization of the forestry trade will devastate not only the environment, but the economies of the developing countries that play host to the rainforests

roleset.note: LIBERALIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'liberalize' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from liberalize.01-v predicate notes)
LIBERALIZATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, liberalize.01. No VNcls. (from liberalization.01-n)

roleset.name: politically/socially liberal

example.name: liberal-j
example.text: Jeb Bush is too liberal to run for the GOP nomination
example.arg: to run for the GOP nomination

roleset.note: LIBERAL-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from liberal.01-j)

role.descr: generous with what, thing given generously

example.name: liberal-j
example.text: We should be liberal with our gratitude to Jim Schwall for feeling free enough to suggest today's very topical Good Word.
example.arg: with our gratitude to Jim Schwall
for feeling free enough to suggest today's very topical Good Word.
